snippet: Seoul, South Korea, has become a boomtown for American musicals, with producers opening Korean-language versions of hits and flops alike.
abstract: Seoul, South Korea, has become a boomtown for American musicals; Korean and Broadway producers are tapping into an audience of young women raised on the bombast of Korean pop and the histrionics of television soap operas; ticket sales to musicals have growing from $9 million in 2000 to an estimated $300 million in 2013, and a frenzy of licensing deals is underway.
lead_paragraph: Seoul, South Korea, has become a boomtown for American musicals, with producers opening Korean-language versions of hits and flops alike.

headline.main: Musicals Couldn’t Be Hotter Off Broadway (by 7,000 Miles)
headline.print_headline: Musicals Couldn’t Be Hotter Off Broadway (by 7,000 Miles)
